quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Capital and Ireland
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, actor, cape. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: What cape is the northernmost point of the second largest continent in the world, Africa?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Cape Blanc

questions.question: Which capital is NOT situated on an island?
Which of the following films did not star renowned Oscar-nominated Irish actor, Liam Neeson?
Which city used to serve as the capital of West Germany?
What are the two official national languages of Ireland?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Irish and English

questions.question: Prague is the capital of the Czech Republic. Bratislava is the capital of the Slovak Republic. Which city used to be the capital of Czechoslovakia?
Irish Fest, the largest celebration of Irish music and culture in the world, is held annually in which location?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Wisconsin, USA

questions.question: What is the main ingredient in Boxty cakes, a traditional Irish dish?
What famous female Irish pirate of the 1500s was condemned to death, but later pardoned by Queen Elizabeth?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Grace OMalley

questions.question: Belgrade was the capital of former Yugoslavia. Which country has the city as its capital today?
Legend has it that this European capital was founded by twins raised by a female wolf.
According to legends, St. Patrick, the patron saint and national apostle of Ireland, is most well known for doing what?

options.text: Driving all the snakes away from Ireland
Helping Pope Celestine deal with infidels
Setting on fire all statues of pagan gods

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Driving all the snakes away from Ireland

questions.question: Blarney Stone, a block of limestone built in one of the battlements of Blarney Castle in Ireland, is said to give great eloquence to everyone who kisses it.
Which ancient Celtic custom, once practiced in Ireland, involved tying the brides and grooms wrists together?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Hand Fastening

questions.question: What is the motto of Republic of Sudan, the African country with the largest area?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Victory is ours.

quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: Capital and Country
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, brazil, independence. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Which city is the worlds most northern capital?
The Organization of Petroleum Exporting Countries (OPEC) is based in this European capital.
Which country has Valletta as its capital?
On September 7, Brazil commemorates its independence from this country.
It is believed that the American Labor Day originates from a parade, organized on September 5, 1882 in this city.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: New York City

questions.question: If you go to New York City, you might hear about Macys Day, another name for this Federal Holiday.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Thanksgiving Day

questions.question: Which river flows through four European capitals?

The Birthday of Dr. Martin Luther King, Jr. is a Federal Holiday as a result of a large-scale campaign. This famous musician, who is also the writer and performer of  Happy Birthday, was one of the most notable activists of this campaign..
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Stevie Wonder

questions.question: In the US, Loyalty Day is celebrated on May 1st with parades and ceremonies. It was first observed in the 1930s and was designed as a counterweight to this holiday.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: May Day

questions.question: The Chinese New Year is the most important of all traditional Chinese holidays and is celebrated on this date.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The date is not fixed

questions.question: What is the capital of Switzerland?
Which of these cities is NOT located on the shore of the Baltic sea?
Which capital was supposedly founded by Ulysses, after he left Troy escaping the Greeks?
Remembrance Day or Armistice Day is observed on November 11 in the Commonwealth of Nations and various European countries. What does it commemorate?

options.text: The fall of the Berlin Wall
The formation of the European Union
World War I and other wars

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: World War I and other wars

questions.question: Every year on 14 July, France celebrates its national holiday, Fete Nationale, widely known as this.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Bastille Day

quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: Country and Area
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, parliament, mean. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: In 1644, Christmas celebrations were forbidden with an Act of the Parliament in which country?
ANZAC Day is a public holiday celebrated on April 25th, in this country.
312 is an area code in which major metro area?
In 1931,  the Coca-Cola Company developed the picture of Santa Claus, based on a Swedish painting of what Nordic mythical creature?
Which of the following is a popular Christmas song?

options.text: We Wish You A Merry Christmas

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

questions.question: In Russia, the International Womens Day is celebrated on this date.
Area code 213 is one of the original area codes in which major metropolitan area?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Los Angeles

questions.question: The Official Post Office of Santa Claus is situated in which city in Finland?
Which Orthodox Christian church celebrates Christmas on January 7th?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

questions.question: The story in which Santa Claus Rudolph the Red-Nosed Reindeer was first mentioned, was written in which year?
What does the word Christmas mean?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Mass of Christ

questions.question: Every year, this country traditionally presents a Christmas tree to the London citizens to express appreciation for the British support during World War II.
Which of these is not a San Francisco area code?
What is the origin of the tradition of putting Christmas presents in stockings?

options.text: St. Nicholas put some gold coins in stockings of three poor girls.
Santa Claus gives the dwarfs stockings every Christmas.
The Magi brought Jesus gifts in stockings.
The elves put fruit and candies in all childrens stockings.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: St. Nicholas put some gold coins in stockings of three poor girls.

questions.question: Which Nordic god was killed with a mistletoe twig, a traditional decoration for Christmas?

quizzes.title: History Quiz: Area and Code
quizzes.description: Test your history knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering History, jupiter, none. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Name two styles of vase painting developed in Ancient Greece.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: black figure and red figure

questions.question: What were the two leading city-states of Ancient Greece?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Athens and Sparta

questions.question: The Irish are considered lucky because Ireland has none of what creature?
If Im Sleepless in Seattle in area code 206, and I call into area code 205, Ive called into the state of Kentucky.
Provo, Utah is located in the same area code as Salt Lake City.
Which term refers to a method of education based on inquiry and examination of key moral concepts?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: the Socratic method

questions.question: If I make a call into the 718 area code, what general area am I calling into?

options.text: North of the Greater Miami area

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Boroughs of New York

questions.question: How did Socrates die?

options.text: He was killed during the war.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: He was poisoned.

questions.question: What is the capital of the Republic of Ireland?
Was South Carolinas original area code 843?
Which empire was the historical enemy of Ancient Greece?
What did Pericles call the School of Hellas?
Which area code has been variously described as The Donut around Los Angeles?
What geographic feature divides the 213 area code from the 818 area code?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: A range of Mountains.

questions.question: Jupiter was the chief Greek God on Mount Olympus.

quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: Ireland and Thanksgiving Day
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, world, nations. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: The Thanksgiving Day Parade held in this city is regarded as the nations first.
When did the Irish Civil War end?
Turducken is sometimes served in place of the Thanksgiving turkey. Do you know what it is?

options.text: White cabbage fermented by Lactobacillus bacteria
A turkey stuffed with a duck stuffed with a chicken

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: A turkey stuffed with a duck stuffed with a chicken

questions.question: What is the name of the national anthem of Ireland, adopted in 1926?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Soldiers Song

questions.question: What are the colors of the Irish flag?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: green, white, orange

questions.question: What is the most common religion in the Republic of Ireland?
Is English an official language of the Republic of Ireland?
How many counties are there in the Republic of Ireland?
It is obvious that vegetarians and vegans dont eat turkey on Thanksgiving day. This meal is a meatless imitation of turkey.
Macys Thanksgiving Day Parade is held annually, every Thanksgiving Day, in this US city.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: New York City

questions.question: In Canada, Thanksgiving Day is celebrated on the second Monday in October. What holiday is celebrated on that same day in the United States?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Columbus Day

questions.question: In 1970, a group labeled the United Native Americans of New England started a protest that is held annually on Thanksgiving Day and is called this.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: National Day of Mourning

questions.question: About how long has the island of Ireland been inhabited?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

questions.question: The day after Thanksgiving Day is called this in the United States.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Black Friday

questions.question: Ireland is the second largest island in Europe.

quizzes.title: History Quiz: State and Capital
quizzes.description: Test your history knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering History, pilgrims, ship. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: In modern warfare, which alert level of DEFCON (DEFense CONditions) signifies maximum readiness of the US Army forces?
The capital of this eastern state is Hartford.
This state, that is home of Mount Whitney, is the third biggest state in the US.
The roasted turkey is a traditional meal on Thanksgiving Day in the US and Canada. It is also a traditional meal on this holiday in the United Kingdom.
In the year 1620, this ship carried 102 Pilgrims from Plymouth, England to the shores of North America.
It is the smallest state in size, and was also the last of the original thirteen colonies to become a state.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Rhode Island

questions.question: It is the only US state that starts with two vowels. Dubuque is the states oldest city.
It is known as the Lone Star State and is home to the Alamo.
Тhe first Thanksgiving celebration is said to have taken place in the autumn of 1619 in this US state.

Jerusalem is of great importance to Jews, Christians and Muslims. It is closely linked to the lives of prophets such as David, Salomon and Jesus Christ. According to the Bible, which of the following is attributed to king Salomon?

options.text: Declaring Jerusalem capital of the Kingdom of Israel
Defending the city against a Roman siege
Building the First Jewish Temple in Jerusalem

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Building the First Jewish Temple in Jerusalem

questions.question: Although the state is often called the Wolverine State there are no longer any wolverines in it.
Stone Mountain, one of the largest single masses of exposed granite in the world, is located in this state.
In what state is the Space Needle located?
Dwight D. Eisenhowers family settled in this state in 1892. Its capital city is Topeka.
This states capital is Augusta.
